intro: Gaertnera rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined guanacaste, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking red veins in its leaves. The plant produces showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its bark is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Gaertnera rufinervis is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in well-drained soils.
